Instrument.name: HISCALE Composition Aperature for Ulysses
Instrument.description: The Composition Aperture system (CA), also known as "WART" in the Ulysses project, employs a multiparameter detection technique to measure ion composition using detectors designed for high sensitivity in distinguishing low-energy electron and ion fluxes. The CA telescope, referred to as CA 60, incorporates pairs of silicon detectors and operates using a priority scheme that balances the analysis of various ion species based on their frequency of occurrence in previous events. The system includes logic channels for discrete ion composition, which are monitored and telemetered for performance analysis. Various channels for particular energy ranges and their performance metrics are detailed in accompanying tables. Overall, the composition detection aims to provide accurate measurements of ion species in space using sophisticated prioritization and monitoring techniques.
